**The Orb of Fate** is the [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"). It is the prize for completing the [Valkyrie quest](/wiki/Valkyrie_quest "Valkyrie quest"), and is [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") for [wishing](/wiki/Wish "Wish") purposes. Its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") type is a [crystal ball](/wiki/Crystal_ball "Crystal ball").

It is often called the **Orb of Weight** by some players, due to its base item's heavy [weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight") of 150 aum.

## Description

When carried, the Orb confers [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning"), [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage"), [half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage") and acts as a [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone"). When [applied](/wiki/Apply "Apply"), it acts as a normal crystal ball. When #[invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke"), it allows the player to [level teleport](/wiki/Level_teleport "Level teleport").

When [read](/wiki/Read "Read"), it gives this message:

```
 It is signed:  "Odin."
```

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

For crystal balls in general: You can now search for [dungeon features](/wiki/Dungeon_feature "Dungeon feature") by entering any of [<](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase") [>](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase") [\_](/wiki/Altar "Altar") [\\](/wiki/Throne "Throne") [#](/wiki/Sink "Sink") [{](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain"). Doing so will find all of these features regardless of which one you entered.

The intelligence check when applying a crystal ball now uses a d8 instead of d20 if it is your own [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"), or d16 for other blessed crystal balls.

Crystal balls are now generated with 3-7 charges. Uncursed charging adds 1-2 charges up to the maximum of 7. Blessed charging increases the number of charges to 7 and also blesses the ball. Cursed charging removes all charges and curses the ball.

Applying a [cancelled](/wiki/Cancelled "Cancelled") crystal ball now destroys it, regardless of whether or not it is an artifact.

## Strategy

The Orb of Fate is extremely useful, serving as a crystal ball and luckstone while halving most forms of damage. Despite its weight, the Orb needs to be held in main inventory for you to benefit from its effects. The #invoke effect of level teleportation is useful with [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control") for speedy travel, and can save you some cursed [scrolls of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation").

Neutral characters may consider the Orb of Fate for an artifact wish after obtaining both [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") and [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), since the Orb provides no protection against [instadeath](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The changes for intelligence checks make the Orb viable for use as a crystal ball by Valkyries, allowing it to be applied for reliable detection of the [vibrating square](/wiki/Vibrating_square "Vibrating square") or [magic portals](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") on the [Planes](/wiki/Planes "Planes"). This also saves resources that would be spent on writing or obtaining [scrolls of gold detection](/wiki/Scroll_of_gold_detection "Scroll of gold detection") for cursed/confused readings.

## Encyclopedia entry

Some say that Odin himself created this ancient crystal ball,  
although others argue that Loki created it and forged Odin's  
signature on the bottom. In any case, it is a powerful  
artifact. Anyone who carries it is granted the gift of  
warning, and damage, both spell and physical, is partially  
absorbed by the orb itself. When invoked it has the power  
to teleport the invoker between levels.
